responses: Hello! Welcome to Swasth AI. How can I assist you with your health today?
Hi there! I'm Swasth AI. Ask me about health issues, symptoms, or wellness tips.
Common flu symptoms include fever, cough, sore throat, runny nose, muscle aches, and fatigue. Rest and hydration are key. If symptoms persist, consult a doctor.
Headaches can be caused by dehydration, stress, or lack of sleep. Try drinking water, resting in a dark room, or applying a cold compress.
COVID-19 affects different people in different ways. Common symptoms include fever, cough, tiredness, and loss of taste or smell. Isolate yourself and seek medical advice if needed.
Diabetes symptoms include frequent urination, increased thirst, and unexplained weight loss. Management involves a healthy diet, regular exercise, and monitoring blood sugar levels.
High blood pressure often has no symptoms but can lead to heart disease. Reduce salt intake, exercise regularly, and manage stress to keep it in check.
For minor burns, cool the burn under running cool tap water for 10-20 minutes. Do not use ice or butter. Cover loosely with a sterile bandage.
Clean the cut with water, apply pressure to stop bleeding, and cover with a sterile bandage. Seek medical help if the cut is deep or bleeding won't stop.

A balanced diet includes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. limit sugars, saturated fats, and sodium for better health.
Anxiety can differ for everyone. deep breathing (4-7-8 technique), grounding exercises, and talking to a professional can help manage it.
To manage stress, try regular exercise, meditation, getting enough sleep, and connecting with loved ones. It's okay to take a break.
Adults should aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity activity per week. consistency is keyâ€”find an activity you enjoy!
Good sleep hygiene includes a consistent schedule, a dark and cool room, and avoiding screens before bed. Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep.
Staying hydrated is crucial. Aim for about 8 glasses (2 liters) of water a day, more if you are active or in hot weather.
Allergies occur when your immune system reacts to a foreign substance. avoided triggers and antihistamines can help. See an allergist for severe cases.
